bio: Riyan Singh is a professional chef with over 10 years of experience in the culinary industry. He specializes in French and Italian cuisine and has worked in several Michelin-starred restaurants. After graduating from culinary school, John began his career as a line cook at a local French bistro. He quickly worked his way up the ranks and eventually became the head chef at the bistro. From there, John moved on to work at a number of high-end restaurants, including a 3-Michelin-starred establishment in Paris. In addition to his work in the restaurant industry, John is also a passionate food writer and has contributed articles to a number of culinary publications. He is known for his innovative recipes that blend classic French and Italian techniques with modern flavors and ingredients.

recipes.cookingMethod: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.  Cook pancetta in a pan until crispy.  Beat eggs and parmesan cheese in a bowl.  Drain spaghetti and add to the pan with pancetta.  Remove from heat and add egg mixture.  Stir until the sauce thickens.  Season with black pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 325°F.  Cook bacon in a large Dutch oven until crispy.  Remove bacon and brown beef in bacon fat.  Add onion and carrots and cook until tender.  Add red wine and bring to a boil.  Cover Dutch oven and place in oven.  Cook for 2-3 hours until beef is tender.  Serve with crusty bread.

Preheat oven to 325°F.  Cook bacon in a large Dutch oven until crispy.  Remove bacon and brown beef in bacon fat.  Add onion and carrots and cook until tender.  Add red wine and bring to a boil.  Cover Dutch oven and place in oven.  Cook for 2-3 hours until beef is tender.  Serve with crusty bread.
